title: Can steroids save your life? - Anees Bahji

multiple-choice.question: What is the term "steroid" referring to in the context of biology?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of exercise routine used to build muscle.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of fatty molecule found in the body.

options.label: C
options.text: A group of substances with a shared molecular structure.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of medication used to treat infections.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of steroids in the body?

options.label: C
options.text: A naturally occurring substance called cortisol.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of hormone produced by the thyroid gland.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of cortisol in the body?
What is the effect of cortisol on the immune system?

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the immune response.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of medicinal corticosteroids?

options.label: C
options.text: To channel the effects of cortisol on the immune system to fight allergic reactions and inflammation.

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce inflammation in the body.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between intravenous or oral corticosteroids and inhalers or creams?

options.label: A
options.text: The former are used to treat chronic autoimmune conditions, while the latter are used to treat acute conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: The former impact the whole body, while the latter only impact the affected organ.

options.label: C
options.text: The former are used to treat infections, while the latter are used to treat allergies.

options.label: D
options.text: The former are used to build muscle, while the latter are used to reduce inflammation.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of long-term exposure to corticosteroids on the body?

options.label: B
options.text: It reduces the immune system's ability to regenerate bone marrow and lymph nodes.

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on the immune system.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of synthetic steroids?

options.label: C
options.text: To enhance the body's cortisol supply and shut down hyperactive immune responses.

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce inflammation in the body.

multiple-choice.question: What is the mechanism of action of corticosteroids?

options.label: A
options.text: They turn off the "fire alarm" by suppressing gene expression of inflammatory signals.

options.label: C
options.text: They have no effect on the immune response.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They are all caused by bacterial infections.

options.label: C
options.text: They all have an immune response that's doing more harm than good.

options.label: D
options.text: They are all caused by allergies.

title: Which voting system is the best? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the fairest way to conduct a vote to determine the location of a new space port on Mars?

options.label: A
options.text: Let each individual cast a single ballot and choose the location with the most votes.

options.label: B
options.text: Use instant runoff voting, which accounts for the full range of people's preferences rather than just their top choices.

options.label: C
options.text: Use a system like plurality voting, which is known as "first past the post."

options.label: D
options.text: Let voters express a preference in every possible head-to-head matchup.

multiple-choice.question: Which voting system accounts for the full range of people's preferences rather than just their top choices?

options.label: A
options.text: They are allocated to the winner of the election.

options.label: B
options.text: They are discarded and do not count towards the final result.

options.label: C
options.text: They are allocated to the voter's second choice.

options.label: D
options.text: They are allocated to the voter's third choice.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Condorcet method?

options.label: A
options.text: A system of voting where voters rank each option from 1 to 4.

options.label: B
options.text: A system of voting where voters express a preference in every possible head-to-head matchup.

options.label: C
options.text: A system of voting where the winner is determined by the number of votes in the first round.

options.label: D
options.text: A system of voting where the winner is determined by the number of votes in the second round.

multiple-choice.question: What is a problem with the Condorcet method?

options.label: A
options.text: It can lead to a tie in the election.

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to a situation where no winner is selected.

options.label: C
options.text: It can lead to a situation where the winner is not the most preferred option.

options.label: D
